summary: This is a formal notification letter from the Warden of the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York to two federal judges, informing them of the death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein. It states Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell on the morning of August 10, 2019, after an apparent suicide, was transported to a hospital, and was pronounced dead. The FBI is investigating, and an autopsy is pending.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) at around 6:30 a.m. He was transported to a hospital and pronounced dead at 7:37 a.m. The incident is described as an apparent suicide and is under FBI investigation.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), 150 Park Row, New York, New York 10007
Daniel Patrick Moynihan United States Courthouse, 500 Pearl Street, New York, New York 10007-1312
New York Presbyterian-Lower Manhattan Hospital, New York, New York
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein died on the morning of August 10, 2019, while in custody at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York.
He was found unresponsive in his cell in the Special Housing Unit at approximately 6:30 a.m. in an incident described as an 'apparent suicide.'
He was pronounced dead at New York Presbyterian-Lower Manhattan Hospital at around 7:37 a.m.
The Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) is actively investigating the incident, and an autopsy to determine the official cause of death is pending.
The notification was sent to Chief Judge Colleen McMahon and Judge Richard M. Berman, who were presiding over his criminal case (19-cr-00490-RMB).
